p.The B.A. program in Philosophy aims to p: The B.A. program in Philosophy aims to provide students with the theoretical skills and knowledge to engage with the complex issues of our time. It centers on the principles of knowledge, responsibility, and society, and it provides students with opportunities to investigate the connections between intellectual pursuits and moral and public virtue.

li.Students who change degree programs and: Students who change degree programs and select this major must adopt the most current catalog.
li.Students must earn at least a \"C\" (2.0: Students must earn at least a "C" (2.0) in each required course.
li.Co-op or internship credit cannot be use: Co-op or internship credit cannot be used in this major without prior departmental approval.
li.Students should consult with a departmen: Students should consult with a departmental advisor.
li.Departmental Residency Requirement consi: Departmental Residency Requirement consists of at least 18 semester hours of regularly scheduled 3000-4000 level courses taken from the UCF Philosophy Department.
li.Courses designated in General Education: Courses designated in General Education Program and Common Program Prerequisites are usually completed in the first 60 hours.

courseSection0.text:
The B.A. program in Philosophy aims to provide students with the theoretical skills and knowledge to engage with the complex issues of our time. It centers on the principles of knowledge, responsibility, and society, and it provides students with opportunities to investigate the connections between intellectual pursuits and moral and public virtue.
Admission Requirements
None
Degree Requirements
Students who change degree programs and select this major must adopt the most current catalog.
Students must earn at least a "C" (2.0) in each required course.
Co-op or internship credit cannot be used in this major without prior departmental approval.
Students should consult with a departmental advisor.
Departmental Residency Requirement consists of at least 18 semester hours of regularly scheduled 3000-4000 level courses taken from the UCF Philosophy Department.
Courses designated in General Education Program and Common Program Prerequisites are usually completed in the first 60 hours.

p.Same requirements as for regular majors,: Same requirements as for regular majors, but must include the following:

li.Select primarily from upper level course: Select primarily from upper level courses after meeting with a departmental advisor. Courses may be outside the department.
li.Proficiency equivalent to one year of co: Proficiency equivalent to one year of college instruction in a foreign language taught by the Department of Modern Languages and Literatures or the Department of History (Hebrew). Standardized examinations for foreign languages may be used to meet the requirement. Majors who are contemplating graduate school should complete two years of a foreign language, preferably one functional in their area of proposed graduate interest.
li.Signature Experience requirement is met: Signature Experience requirement is met by successful completion of the following course(s):
li.PHI 4938 - Senior Research Seminar Credi: PHI 4938 - Senior Research Seminar Credit Hours: 3
li.Earn a \"C\" (2.0) or better in each req: Earn a "C" (2.0) or better in each required course.
li.Departmental Exit Exam in final semester: Departmental Exit Exam in final semester, included in PHI 4938 - Senior Research Seminar
li.To avoid delaying graduation, you must r: To avoid delaying graduation, you must request a review of requirements prior to registering for your last term.
li.42 semester hours of upper division cred: 42 semester hours of upper division credit completed
li.60 semester hours earned after CLEP awar: 60 semester hours earned after CLEP awarded
li.30 of the last 39 hours of course work m: 30 of the last 39 hours of course work must be completed in residency at UCF.
li.A maximum of 45 hours of extension, corr: A maximum of 45 hours of extension, correspondence, CLEP, Credit by Exam, and Armed Forces credits permitted.
li.Complete the General Education Program,: Complete the General Education Program, the Gordon Rule, and nine hours of Summer credit.
li.Students considering graduate school in: Students considering graduate school in philosophy are strongly encouraged to take Honors in the Major. Requirements are as follows:
li.PHI 2101 - Formal Logic I Credit Hours:: PHI 2101 - Formal Logic I Credit Hours: 3
li.Same as requirement for regular majors: Same as requirement for regular majors
li.PHI 4903H - Honors Directed Reading I Cr: PHI 4903H - Honors Directed Reading I Credit Hours: 3
li.PHI 4970H - Undergraduate Honors Thesis: PHI 4970H - Undergraduate Honors Thesis Credit Hours: 3

li.Fulfill University requirements for Hono: Fulfill University requirements for Honors in the Major.
li.Maintain UCF GPA of at least 3.2 and a P: Maintain UCF GPA of at least 3.2 and a Philosophy GPA of at least 3.5.
li.Successful completion and oral defense o: Successful completion and oral defense of Honors thesis.
li.Earn a \"B\" (3.0) or better in both of:
Earn a "B" (3.0) or better in both of the following courses:
PHI 4903H - Honors Directed Reading I Credit Hours: 3
PHI 4970H - Undergraduate Honors Thesis Credit Hours: 3
li.Lower division courses do not substitute: Lower division courses do not substitute for upper division courses.
li.Courses transferred from private and out: Courses transferred from private and out-of-state schools must be evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide all supporting information.

courseSection1.text:
Electives

Select primarily from upper level courses after meeting with a departmental advisor. Courses may be outside the department.

courseSection2.text:
Foreign Language Requirements

Admissions
Met by graduation requirement.
Graduation
Proficiency equivalent to one year of college instruction in a foreign language taught by the Department of Modern Languages and Literatures or the Department of History (Hebrew). Standardized examinations for foreign languages may be used to meet the requirement. Majors who are contemplating graduate school should complete two years of a foreign language, preferably one functional in their area of proposed graduate interest.

courseSection3.text:
Additional Requirements

Signature Experience requirement is met by successful completion of the following course(s):

PHI 4938 - Senior Research Seminar Credit Hours: 3

Required Minors

None

courseSection4.text:
Departmental Exit Requirements

Earn a "C" (2.0) or better in each required course.
Departmental Exit Exam in final semester, included in PHI 4938 - Senior Research Seminar
To avoid delaying graduation, you must request a review of requirements prior to registering for your last term.

courseSection5.text:
University Minimum Exit Requirements

A 2.0 UCF GPA
42 semester hours of upper division credit completed
60 semester hours earned after CLEP awarded
30 of the last 39 hours of course work must be completed in residency at UCF.
A maximum of 45 hours of extension, correspondence, CLEP, Credit by Exam, and Armed Forces credits permitted.
Complete the General Education Program, the Gordon Rule, and nine hours of Summer credit.

courseSection7.text:
Honors In Major

Students considering graduate school in philosophy are strongly encouraged to take Honors in the Major. Requirements are as follows:

courseSection8.text:
Core Requirements (36 Credit Hours)

Same requirements as for regular majors, but must include the following:

PHI 2101 - Formal Logic I Credit Hours: 3

Upper Division Restricted Electives (6 Credit Hours)

Same as requirement for regular majors

courseSection9.text:
Honors Thesis

PHI 4903H - Honors Directed Reading I Credit Hours: 3
PHI 4970H - Undergraduate Honors Thesis Credit Hours: 3

courseSection10.text:
Additional Information

Additional Requirements
Application and admission through the Philosophy Honors Coordinator and the Burnett Honors College.
Fulfill University requirements for Honors in the Major.
Maintain UCF GPA of at least 3.2 and a Philosophy GPA of at least 3.5.
Successful completion and oral defense of Honors thesis.
Earn a "B" (3.0) or better in both of the following courses:
PHI 4903H - Honors Directed Reading I Credit Hours: 3
PHI 4970H - Undergraduate Honors Thesis Credit Hours: 3
Related Programs
Humanities and Cultural Studies (B.A.)
Religion and Cultural Studies (B.A.)
Certificates
None
Related Minors
Cognitive Sciences Minor
Environmental Studies Minor
Humanities and Cultural Studies Minor
Religion and Cultural Studies Minor
Women's and Gender Studies Minor
Advising Notes
None
Transfer Notes
Lower division courses do not substitute for upper division courses.
Courses transferred from private and out-of-state schools must be evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide all supporting information.
Acceptable Substitutes for Transfer Courses
None
Program Academic Learning Compacts
Program Academic Learning Compacts (student learning outcomes) for undergraduate programs are located at: http://www.oeas.ucf.edu/alc/academic_learning_compacts.htm

courseSection11.text:
